results.title: Turning 18
results.creator_credit: Video Projects, Open Channel Productions, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: An amusing look at some serious issues that are related to turning eighteen - the age by which a person is legally recognised as an adult in this society. This program, subtitled, “Almost 20 Minutes” is a parody of the current affairs television program, “60 Minutes”.

results.title: Fair go!
results.creator_credit: Victorian Trades Hall Council and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Fair go! is a step towards meeting the needs of young people for information about their rights as workers. Using a fresh, entertaining presentation, the program follows the experiences of school-leavers Kelly and Sam, as they fall unawares into a series of near disasters in new jobs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian Trades Hall Council and Open Channel Productions

results.title: You'll Be Back
results.brief_description:
Looks at the problems of readjustment that prisoners face on their release from gaol. The dramatisation of particular situations illustrates the type of troubles that may occur and representatives from various organisations, such as Legal Aid, Odyssey House and Personal Emergency Services, advise on how to avoid trouble.

Featuring Gary Sweet as the protagonist, and music by Rose Tattoo.

results.title: Not just a number
results.creator_credit: Amalgamated Metal Workers and Shipwrights Union, Rob Richardson and Shalagh McCarthy
results.brief_description: A three part documentary examining industrial democracy in Australia: 1) Job redesign. Demonstrates how employees exercise decision-making, responsibility and initiative in their private lives and contracts with the usual workplace situation where most decisions are made by management. 2) Better managers. Shows a factory owned and operated by the workers providing a working example of successful worker participation and industrial democracy. 3) Is it a con? Examines unsuccessful industrial democracy initiatives where only the semblance of power has been transferred to the workers.

results.title: Children with special abilities
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: This film explores curriculum strategies and organisational approaches which can meet the needs of children with special abilities. The school Principal, several teachers, a consultant and various children are interviewed. Two children, Emma (aged seven) and Campbell (aged ten), are featured to highlight the characteristics and learning needs of such children. Suitable for Tertiary/Teacher education.

results.title: Flamingo Park
results.creator_credit: Clytie Jessop, Women's Film Fund (Australia) and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Shows the works of two artistic and talented Australian fashion designers. Jenny Kee’s colourful designs are inspired by the tones of the bush, birds and flora, whilst Linda Jackson’s inspiration comes from the ocean and the sealife. Jenny’s designs are made up into outstandingly colourful handknitted garments, whilst Linda uses chiffons, cottons and appliqued designs.

results.title: You've got to work for it (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film made by six Diploma of Education students (Bob Sharples, Kamal Monsour, Sally Ford, Derek Burrage, Denis Connolly and Doug Eastman) about the problem migrant adolescents face in Australia. Through group discussions between Italian immigrants, Greek immigrants and first generation immigrant children, a real portrayal of the frustration of immigrant teenagers growing up in Australia is shown. Also gives a brief background history of Greek/Italian migration in the 1960’s and 1970’s from an economical/political point of view. Broadmeadows

results.title: You are not alone
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Zanthus Films and Anti Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a woman who reports a suspected cancer early and undergoes a successful operation. Dramatically presents the advantages of seeking prompt treatment when the warning signs of cancer appear. The patient is referred to a surgeon who, after the operation, introduces the therapy radiographers who complete the treatment to eradicate the disease.

results.title: [The White continent]
results.brief_description:
Please be advised, this film contains graphic footage of animal cruelty.

In late 1949, a joint expedition planned by the Governments of Britain, Norway and Sweden left for Queen Maude Land on the Antarctic continent - this was to be the first truly international expedition to the Antarctic. The film covers the first stage of the journey, from departure point in Europe to the establishment of the base camps and later withdrawal of the ship’s party, leaving the groups of scientists to their study of the unknown world of ice and snow. Photography by Tom Stobart.

results.title: Venezuela
results.brief_description: Although rich in oil, Venezuela is beset with staggering problems. Poverty is rife in its capital - Caracas - where thousands of Indians dwell in one-roomed ranchitos. At the opposite pole are the rich with virtually no middle class between the two. The region of Orinoco seems immune to improvement and overall continued development in Venezuela depends largely on increased efforts in the areas of education and economic reform.
